page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AROUND IGHTHAM
page.content: This area is on the{South Face of {the North Downs.} The main land cover of the area is {Agricultural}crops which are corn, wheat and barley. There are also many{ {Orchards}which grow apples and cherries.{Cobnuts}are unique here. There is also a lot of{Decidous } woodland in the area,such as Oldbury Woods,Clay Pits,Fullen Hill and many more. There are also a few areas of{ {Conifer}Woodland. The area boasts many historical buildings such as the Town House and Ightham Court. Very close by but not in our area is the famous{Ightham {Mote}which has recently been given to the{National Trust.} The main railway from{Maidstone}to {London}runs through the area.
